Hey everybody! Today finally marks the release of “Immune – A Journey Into the Mysterious System that Keeps You Alive”. The book I've sorta started writing a decade ago!

You can get it here: https://kgs.link/ImmuneBook – It’s available in English and German and at online retailers it should be available in pretty much all countries too.

First we had to push the release back because of cargo trouble and then because so many of you pre-ordered that we didn’t have enough copies for the original launch day! Thank you so, so much for that!

Tonight I'm doing an AMA on Reddit where you can ask me about Kurzgesagt, science communication and of course the book! Join here: https://kgs.link/KGS_AMA

In any case – Kurzgesagt is a passion project and it's just so heartwarming how wholesome and supportive our community and viewers are. I'm incredibly grateful to have this job and to be able to make content for all of you, video or printed. – Philipp

Why is it always "the pieces of your GENETIC CODE" etc? Genetic code does not have pieces, it is the code! So, it is the set of rules how the triplets of mRNA translate into aminoacid sequence in the proteins, and almost everyone misrepresents the idea of genetic code mixing it with genetic sequence. Hello Guys :) First of all I really dig your channel and videos. To make them even more enjoyable please stop using phrases like "changing GENETIC CODE". Genetic code is not a DNA or genetic sequence. Genetic code is like English-French dictionary, which tells to Ribosomes how to create protein base on given genetic sequence.
Three out of four Nucleobases (Adenine (A), Cytosine (C), Guanine (G), [Thymine (T) < Only in DNA], [Uracil (U) , only in RNA]) "code" one of 20 Amino acid. They are bonded together by Ribosomes to create a chain of amino acids which basically is a protein. There is also a "code" UAA UAG UGA which STOPs ribosomes from continuation when the protein is complete.
Please remember about Ribosomes and a difference between DNA and genetic code.
Thanks guys, Love you guys :)

What many of us do not (yet) know is that Cancer is not some invading pathogen come to take over your body. Cancer is a group of our own cells that disobey the normal rules of Replicating (making new cells). Cancer cells ignore the usual rules and keep making new cells that take up space and demand for your body to feed them through your circulatory system. Worse of all, these cancer cells were made from your own body, so, sooner or later, your immune system will stop seeing them as abnormal and will see them as just another part of your body, so these cancer cells are no longer attacked.

We are NOT immune to everything. There are things that our system cannot fight, and win against without outside help. This is why we have antibiotics, we look to fungi and bacteria to see how they defend themselves. For the rest that we can win, but our system has no idea what it's looking for and will likely respond far too late, we have vaccines -so that hopefully when the real threat arrives the immune system will recognize it quick enough. But even then, modern vaccines, don't teach the immune system much of anything. They promote the system to flood our bodies with an antibody, that is no more alive than virus is. It's of course mechanical. It bumps into something that the keys fit into and it latches on, like a boot to a double parked muscle car. Gatcha! If this doesn't happen because the antibody never finds a place to latch on, and the virus finds a cell to infect first... The immune system may take too long to respond and by the time it does, a fast spreading virus SARS has already taken over. SARS also manipulates how cells signal for help, bending the calls to the immune system to further befit the virus. But also our systems don't make all antibodies all of the time, they switch over as time passes. Thus why we are pushing boosters so much for SARS, even if the boosters still only offer identification of Alpha Variant. T cells are the ultimate destroyers but take time to build up, thanks to that 2% rule.

The problem with even suggesting that we are immune to everything is misleading, far too many are dumb enough to take that statement at face value. So then we end up arguing with morons about microchips in the vaccines.

We have also learned, or rather been very recently reminded that just because the body doesn't see an infection as a threat, doesn't mean it's peacefully coexisting, and even minor threats like the cold have far more sinister plots to hatch. A certain water born virus, known to cause diarrhea, can also cause diabetes. Another very well know virus you might have just recently gotten over is implicated in 7 auto immune disorders. The immune system can run a foul but in my opinion, it's often mislead by bad actors, into attacking healthy cells and as we know, once this starts and the B-Cells have stored the data, the immune system will not stop attacking.

“All chronic pain, suffering and diseases are caused from a lack of oxygen at the cell level."

Arthur C. Guyton, The Textbook of Medical Physiology*, Fifth Edition.

* World’s most widely used medical textbook of any kind
* World's best-selling physiology book
---------------
How can we identify the extent of incorrect breathing?

By measuring "the control pause" and pulse. All known publications describe measuring of the control pause quite vaguely. Below is a clearer description:
The control pause should be preferably measured in standard conditions, after a 10 minute breath-equalizing rest.
Sit conveniently. Take a beautiful, correct posture, spread out your shoulders. The stomach will straighten up. Inhale normally, relax the stomach. Involuntary exhalation will come out by itself. As the exhalation is finished, note the position of the second hand visually and hold breath. During the time of measuring, do not follow the hand, just focus on a spot in front of you or shut your eyes. Do not breathe in until it gets difficult, i.e. until diaphragm's "push" up. Simultaneously, stomach and neck muscles get push too: patients normally describe this condition as a "push in the throat". Read of the second hand's position at the "push" point, and continue breathing. Do not inhale deeper than prior to breath-holding.

Thus measured pairs of stable values "control pause - pulse" determine the stage of your disease by the following rule:

- 1-10 secs. CP (pulse 100): severely sick, critically and terminally ill patients, usually hospitalized;
- 10-20 secs. CP (pulse 90): sick patients with health complaints, often on daily medication;
- 20-30 secs. CP (pulse 80): people with average health, usually without serious chronic health problems;
- 40-60 secs. CP (pulse 70): very good health;
- 60 secs + CP with the pulse below 70: robust health, when many chronic diseases are virtually impossible.
If the control pause rises to 90, 120 or 180 seconds, humans acquire a special resistance to hunger, cold, heat, infection, poisons and increased nuclear radiation.

Stability of values is the "repeatability" of such values within the range corresponding to a specific stage of the disease during at least several days.

There are cases of people who have poor results (less than 20 secs.), but who do not suffer from chronic diseases. Such people typically do not have a genetic predisposition to chronic disease. That said, low body O2 always compromises health and fitness, energy levels, and overall quality of life to some degree.

Some people can have abnormally large CP numbers. This can happen in cases of carotid body resections, denervation of respiratory muscles, and near-death experiences. People with sleep apnea and lost or blunted CO2 sensitivity, can also have exaggerated test results.

At the same time, cases of people with normal breathing (and normal body O2 content) who have low results for the CP test are virtually unknown.
---------------
The purpose of the Buteyko method is to normalize (or improve) your personal unconscious breathing pattern 24/7 so as to provide respiration in accordance with internationally accepted medical and physiological norms. Practically speaking, the method is designed to eliminate chronic alveolar hyperventilation (or too much breathing) and to restore the normal balance between carbon dioxide and oxygen in the lungs, blood and all cells.
---------------
For more information on the Buteyko method & covid-19, please read the following 4 articles:

- Dr. A. Novozhilov (2020) “COVID-19: Prevention And Treatment”

- Dr. A. Novozhilov (2020) “Covid-19, Why Mechanical Ventilation Doesn't Help”

- Kazarinov V.A. (1990) "The biochemical basis of KP Buteyko's theory of the diseases of deep respiration"

- V.K. Buteyko, M.M. Buteyko (2005) “The Buteyko theory about a key role of breathing for human health: scientific introduction to the Buteyko therapy for experts”

There are some diseases we humans can never develop an immunity to, because their means of attack is so different from what our immune system is used to. I'm thinking of prion diseases like Creutzfeldt-Jakob, AKA Mad Cow Disease. It is not caused by a bacteria, parasite or virus, but by a self-propagating misfold of a protein that occurs naturally in your brain. When a misfolded prion protein encounters a normally folded protein, it catalyzes the normal protein to misfold itself as well.

A healthy immune system won''t recognize these misfolded prions because the protein is supposed to be there, and in the process of binding to a receptor the protein stretches back into its expected shape. As far as your immune system is concerned, all normal. But even if it could, your immune system has no mechanism to handle rogue protein molecules. They have no receptors or surface to bind to. They can't be broken down into their component molecules because they are already a molecule. They are orders of magnitude smaller than even the smallest virus, smaller than most of the weapons your immune system can attack with. There's nothing your body can do about a prion disease.

I am 61 years old. My children asked me 14 yrs ago if people fro my planet EVER catch colds or flu. I said to her "I get sick sometimes." She replied "no you don't, not in MY lifetime". Is it possible that MY adaptive immune system, having had 16 years to boot-up is REALLY that much better than most at defending me? I don't avoid contact with others but practice a philosophy of all things in moderation. I've reduced eating processed foods, sugar etc as I no longer like the way I feel after. Excellent video as always. By the way, I've already learned most of this while watching the very entertaining and highly educational anime Cells at Work (Hataraku Saibou). They dedicated a full episode on the.. 'Murder University' thymus which they somehow managed to make both macabre and funny. That mere 2% of graduation rate - 98% death rate from thymus was also mentioned there.

They also made a clear distinction between the innate and the adaptive immune system over many episodes, like you did. They two leads are a neutrophil white blood cell (an innate immune system cell) and a red blood cell. I learned more about the human body and the immune system specifically while watching the two seasons of this anime than the tens of Wikipedia articles I've read, and I also had quite a lot of fun :)

Cells at Work is the only anime I have heard being praised by multiple doctors and immunologists, though I do not recommend its spin-off Cells at Work Black, at least not as a first watch. Black is grittier and darker, and the animation quality is lower.

8:13 I heard somewhere (not sure if it's true, but it seems reasonable) that this process is how we end up with certain allergies. Essentially, our body produces a cell that would react to, say, a type of pollen, but it produces it in the winter when there is no pollen. Since it doesn't react to anything, it becomes part of the 2% that survives. Come spring time, this cell freaks the hell out on contact with this type of pollen and your body launches an immune attack, assuming this threat is real. That's why we sometimes spontaneously develop allergies later in life to innate things we are exposed to somewhat regularly

In 2016 a Nobel Prize was awarded for studies into autophagy. Autophagy is the name for what the body does when we withdraw from food and drink long enough to allow the body to remove from the great lymphatic system bio-accumulated matter, neurotoxins, heavy metals, etcetera. Phase II of autophagy begins at day nine of a dry fast.

If there is such thing as an immune system, only through the lymphatic system is it able to exist and function. We never give enough attention to the lymphatic system. We need to start learning about it as well as the "immune system." The "immune system" is a hypothetical idea of how the lymphatic system functions on a microscopic level. The lymphatic system, however, is an actual system, and not much is done to understand the things that the theory of the "immune system" doesn't answer. These loose ends can be tied together through studying and examining the lymphatic system. So I urge everyone to look into it. You may find it interesting and perhaps even helpful in solving other mysteries regarding the human body, as these systems often depend on each other and are therefore connected.

Dr. Mike Williams does a great job of explaining the probable mechanism behind the mRNA vaccines and why they have been engineered to TURN OFF a key element in our immune system response (this element is particular TLRs or toll-like receptors). Turning off this component permits the mRNA to enter our cells to do its job. When these are neutralized or prevented from working, however, there is then a knock-on effect on the CD8 T-cells, which are vital to a robust immune-system response. They are your ‘killer’ cells which, among other things, keep viruses in check. When you turn off certain TLRs, you also disable these highly necessary T-cells.

￼

by

DR MIKE WILLIAMS

Saturday, 30th October 2021

It was hypothesised that the functional change may be connected to anecdotal reports of both an increase and change in cancer presentation. Given the like/dislike ratio I am obviously in an incredible minority...but I'd like to express some feedback to my dislike:

There was something that seemed kind of gross and exploitative near the end of the video, where you basically ask the question about why we die from illnesses like COVID-19 when we should biologically have defenses against all diseases in the universe. To convey such clear and interesting information only to withhold a question we would all have, and then end up framing it around a huge global suffering that is still ongoing felt very manipulative. Especially because it revolves around making a sale.

To frame it a bit more concisely, it felt the same as if you had said "The human body is actually not capable of getting cancer. Wait...but doesn't your mom have it, and isn't she dying a slow and agonizing death? How can that be? Well glad you asked! Buy this book".

Anyway, that's my two cents. I still appreciated the video and consider you to be one of the best (if not THE best) channel on this dumpster fire of a website. In my humble opinion, the ending could use a little re-framing. Thanks for reading.

Just to answer the question: If we have all the weapons against all diseases, why COVID still kills. The reason is because the adaptive immune system is SLOW. It takes about 2 weeks or more for the adaptive immune system to start spitting out antibodies that can have moderate effects against the infection. However, within these 2 week time, many diseases would already have enough time to cause significant damage to your body, and can even affect the antibody generation process itself. This is why COVID still kills because by the time our body recognise and ready to produce antibodies, it's already too weak to do so.
This is also why getting the vaccine is so important! Vaccines work by giving our body the training it needs to produce antibodies WITHOUT causing actual damage by the disease. So when the body actually encounters the disease, it's just ready to go!
You might think this is obvious enough but I have talked to many anti vaxxers who have absolutely ZERO knowledge of how this works, and zero training yet spitting out misinformation that they "learned" from Facebook university as if its all facts and argue with people who actually been trained for years. Two practitioners spoke at the Middlesex County council meeting on August 3, 2021.

Wayne H. Jessie is the Chairman of the Board of Supervisors in Middlesex County

Wayne H. Jessie, Chairman of the Board of Supervisors, said he was unaware of the forced organ harvesting by the CCP from Falun Gong practitioners and prisoners of conscience.

On a side note: German scientists discovered that severe COVID cases are in part caused by an early shutdown of your immune system. It naturally produces messenger proteins called Cytokines to regulate the speed and aggressiveness with which the immune system works against pathogens. Our immune system sometimes overreacts to SARS-CoV-2, causing it to produce a large amount of a cytokine called TGF-Beta, which then suppresses the immune system and lets the virus wreak havoc freely.

The good part is, we already have pharmaceuticals that block the TGF-Beta. These are currently used in treating cancer and rheumatic diseases.

Hot take: the human brain that makes a vaccine in a lab is also part of the immune system.

Why do we get sick? Simple - because immune system isn't very quick. It often takes multiple days, before immune system obtains sample of infection agent and produces necessary countermeasure.
Worst of all, some produced antibodies can be defective and make infection destroy very immune cells, that supposed to destroy it(so called antibody-dependent infection amplification).
Second, and that's reason why Covid-19 is so deadly - if immune system kicks into overdrive, it causes severe damage to the body in the process of fighting infection, in this case, it's lungs, and you can't live without functional lungs. It's called cytokine storm, and can be compared to nuclear arsenal of immune system, that is used as last desperate attempt to clear infection, but certain viruses can trick your immune system into using it early.

A big section missing is allergens, that's when your immune system isn't attacking your own body or a enemy microorganism, but something otherwise harmless if not for the overreaction of your body and often inert/not "alive"(not even in the virus sense) thus rather undestroyable. Especially how do allergens appear and how does your body learn to overcome them? It's confusing because it seems exposer to common potential allergens can both cause allergies and prevent or cure them depending on factors.

Another interesting aspect of the immune system is how the body learns when it does need to attack your own cells, like in the case of cancer. BTW AFAIK cancer is when cells death gene breaks. Most cells are designed to eventually die and be replaced, when cells become immortal because the mechanism for them to die breaks, and then divide making more cells that also don't die, you get cancer. Often our bodies are unable to know to attack cancer, but sometimes your body does attack cancer cells and many "cancers" come and go unknown to us for a variety of reasons, including our own immune system.

“去以六月息者也”，问题来了，这个大鹏鸟比我们享福，六月间，我们还在这个地方研究《庄子》，大鹏鸟放暑假，它到南方去凉快了。这个话，古人听了一定不相信，南方热得要死，大鹏鸟怎么飞到南方来呢？现在人都会相信了，知道南极是零下不晓得多少度，冻得要死。大概大鹏鸟觉得这个世界发烧了，也许北极冰山化了，人类乱搞，它要到南极那个大冰山去凉快凉快。问题是为什么不在五月，不在八月，七月半也可以呀！但它为什么一定要在六月去呢？

读书要注意啊！这个六月的问题，学过《易经》的就知道了。

就是那个十二辟卦，夏至一阴生，接着是六月。十二辟卦代表一年十二个月，就是代表了地球气候整个的旋转。这个气运的旋转，显示地球及宇宙物理的变化。

什么叫息呢？要注意中国的文字。息不是完了啊！息是成长，所以消息两个字要注意。消是放射的，是消耗，是完了。息是回转来成长，是充电，充了电再放射！所以它六月到那里是补充，是充电。这个“息”跟“消”，两个道理要搞清楚。

我们再回转来看，庄子提出来的，首先是沉潜飞动，说明一个大鱼化成鹏鸟，就是说明了物化的开始，万物都在变化。下面讲到六月，消息来了，他告诉我们消息。

ThEn WhY iS tHeRe A pAnDeMiC

another way to think about is like this. The proteins of pathogens are like a lock, and receptors are a key. In order for your body to recognize the pathogen it has to have the right key (receptor) to fit into the lock. There are millions of locks and millions of potential pathogens. That's a lot of keys your body has to have. instead of trying to pick the locks, your body makes a factory where it produces millions of keys, and each key is unique and completely random; after making sure each key doesn't fit into the locks of your own body, these keys are stored and saved until a new pathogen comes by that happens to fit the key.

I've just started reading the book but I've found that the grammar is pretty terrible. There are some very basic errors such as random capitalisation (like after colons for some reason) and the introduction being cut in half by an out of place double page picture, but also some more serious ones like constant misuse of commas and semicolons. I have found it hard to grasp the meaning of some sentences and had to reread them several times because the clauses are a complete mess and don't convey the meaning of the sentence at all. Also, the writer seems to go through periods of starting several sentences the same way (extremely frequently starting sentences with 'And' and 'But') making some sections tiresome to read. I feel like I'm being pedantic but unfortunately I'm immediately struggling to read the book, more importantly I'm struggling to focus on the content through the grammatical blunders. It's worth saying that I love the content, genuinely one of the best science communication sources available (not just on YouTube) but it seems that the book is failing to just plain old communicate. This should not be taken as hate - just perhaps an honest review.

Correction: You said proteins can come in "billions" of shapes. That is... quite underselling it. Might as well claim they only come in 4 shapes. Whatever the word is for how many forms proteins can take, I'm pretty sure we don't have a word for it. It's definitely quite a few orders of magnitude about a quadrillion. Even if the sequence of base proteins is the same, if it folds up differently, it's effectively a completely different protein, so you need to consider every folding of every sequence, not just every sequence. And there are definitely quadrillions of sequences in your body right now.

Valiant effort trying to make the immune system understandable to general audiences, it's a fantastically complicated subject that no one knows all the details to yet! One thing I'd love to see you guys mention or cover at some point is the fact that mutations of pathogens are not certain to be bad for us. Mutations can let the pathogens evade our immune system, but they can also immediately make the pathogen totally harmless, unable to infect human cells, unable to transmit from one human to another, etc. It's entirely possible a new variant of SARS-CoV-2 could emerge that outcompetes existing variants, but also is far less lethal. It would have an evolutionary advantage, as dead people don't spread viruses and we don't try so hard to avoid non-lethal pathogens.

I pre-ordered Immune some time ago and my copy arrived today. When I first pre-ordered my impression was that it would likely be something like a TIME Life book (Informative but extremely large and thin with just as much illustration as text if not more). Which seemed fun if not a little kiddish. But when I opened my package today I was in for a pleasant surprise.

This thing is a properly meaty, hard cover, dusk jacketed, All about X book. It about 300 9x7 pages when disregarding glossary, preface and index. The images in it are in that familiar style. However rather than the images telling half or more of the story as they might do with the videos. They are a lot more sparing and strategically placed as key visual aids. It's a lot more like you might find in a textbook. But without section exercises and tests.

Having just given it a light flip through thus far (what I like to call getting hand-familiar with a book), it looks like a real quality product. I can see why it in part took a good while to start rolling out. I'm looking forward to diving into it in my free time. This will likely be my main read for the foreseeable future.

She got it a second time 5-6 months later and was only sick for a week, and a lot less sick than the first time. I didn’t even get sick at all from that one, even when we both went to get tested to see if she actually had it (while she was sick) hers came back positive and mine negative.

>If this is true, why do we still get sick?

Because somatic hypermutation is ultimately random and not guaranteed, and B cells kill each other in gladiator wars for best binding. The result is that only a percentage of people get the antibodies or T cell receptors that are effective. Even with superior focused antigen targeting of a vaccine, only 90-95% of people end up having a good titer of neutralizing antibodies, so 1/10-1/20 people are not expected to be immune to covid.

Sadly, the human immune system, while beautifully complex, is like with anything that evolved chaotically, a piece of inefficient garbage.

When your body is literally a war zone

To put a long and complicated story short, one big reason it takes so long for you to fight off one disease or another is because the library of every possible enemy is absolutely massive. There's an infinite library thought experiment somewhere...

Consider a library that has every possible book. Within it is Shakespeare's biography, the cure for cancer, the secret to interstellar space travel, and every answer you could ever want. The issue is that it also has millions of copies of these books nearby, with small typos. It has a book that seems to be the cure for cancer, but the solution given doesn't actually do anything. It has a convincing argument for homeopathy. It has EVERY book. EVERY BOOK.

Your immune system cannot save you from every disease at first because to find the solution it prepared, it has to sift through all the unrelated, unhelpful books first.

comment_text: My copy of Immune arrived today, so this is great timing.

The Genetic code is NOT the Genome !

The genetic code is a dictionnary used to translate from nucleic acid triplet (codon) to animo acids to produce proteins, it is not a synonym of genome.
Changing the pair of codon/amino acids would induce countless errors in all the protein produced by the ribosomes (and most likely the cell would die rather quickly). We all have the exact same genetic code.

I hope this helps clear up the confusion.

“Our immune system has a defense for every disease ever” is a thought that is highly hubristic of us. Sure our immune system has a defense for every invader we know of, but DNA is not the only code of life. Scientists have recently discovered over a million possible carbon-based alternatives to DNA. It’s possible that early earth could have experimented with these Nucleic Acids b4 settling on DNA, which means, in theory, life on modern earth is not properly adapted 2 handle anything that isn’t DNA-based. What happens if viral life on other bodies in the universe, created from one of these nucleic acids, infects a human? How do we know we will b okay of these life forms have the potential 2 act differently than anything we thought was possible?

I think there is something very unclear, specifically the part where you say that the immune system can recognise friends and foes thanks to proteins, but there are billions of proteins. "This is the reason we still have to deal with the flu" - that's not really true, the body can still recognise itself, hence it can always tell if something isn't body-related (it can be fooled in fact, e.g. by pathogens which hide themselves with other cell's pieces). So the reason we still have to deal with the flu is what you say next, that it mutates every year, i.e. our adaptive immune system has to develop new weapons every single time, but our immune system can still tell the difference between friends and foes, it just isn't prepared for new foes. The "general purpose soldiers" are not ineffective against new threats in the sense, as you seem to imply also visually, that they just can't really recognise them as such and simply let them slip. They CAN tell they are not friends, but since they are "general purpose" indeed, their abilities might not suffice. What the adapative immune system actually does is preparing a precise and specific, thus extremely effective, countermeasure.

0:30 not even thirty seconds into the video, and im screaming "YES, EXACTLY!!" at the screen, when recalling utterly braindead comments by people such as Neil Degrasse Tyson saying "ET civilizations wouldnt bother visiting us, there's nothing interesting here, we're boring".
Just the microcosm of a single large mammal alone, is an entire planet full of different species working in extremely fine-grained cooperation (and opposition) derived from rules set in place over millions and billions of years of unique evolution on this planet.

And every planet's species will be unique in their internal microcosmic chain of inter-dependencies, even if we all shared the exact same DNA structure as we both emerged from our respective primordial oozes.
Anyone thinking Earth isnt unique or interesting, just because the universe may be a teeming jungle full of life, is simply clueless about the marvellous incredible complexity of what goes on inside even a tiny rodent.

It's the equivalent of saying "The MIlky Way galaxy isnt interesting, nobody would visit, because other galaxies exist".
